reviews.review_msg: Well. I felt really struggled before the midterm cuz I just got really bad score on it. But if you make sure you understand the all practice final exams. You will get really perfect grades on final. Good professor but strict.

He's a well-known professor at SFU, famous among students for his rigorous academic approach and the challenging nature of his courses. He's incredibly smart and the TAs are awesome too, all PhDs from SFU. As long as you put in the effort (e=1), you're 100% to succeed in this class (s=1), that is u(s=1|e=1)=1.
Awesome Prof. if you obey his rules,you will get the best grade.

extremely hard class. lectures are sometimes pretty engaging though. plan to spend hours and hours on problem sets. you can get a good grade if you get 100% on problem sets, do well on essay and participate. everyone does poorly on midterm/final. I got an A in the class with 68% on midterm and 55% on final (beat avg by aprox. 20% on both of them).

Very bad prof, take the course with someone else if possible. His lectures are nothing like his exams or problem sets. Has this ridiculous grading criteria. Even if you find the answer right (in different way) he tries to take marks off. Pretty much everyone does bad in his class and he makes sure to make you feel stupid all the time.

He graduated from Harvard. Very smart guys but his exams are all based on postgraduate level. He'll mark you zero if you solved the question in math but not the economic way. Oh lord, I am just good at math and I can use integral or derivative or matrix or whatever to solve them but thanks to you I got zero.
Do not ever take this course. Worst prof ever

his exams are tricky but not too difficult if you have a brain unfortunately most people just expect to be given the answer and not think about what it means. If you want to learn something his class isn't too bad if you wanna go and sit in the back of the class and talk to your buddies all day like most people in our class then be warned.
